title: Madison argues large republic protects liberty

content.question: In The Federalist papers, James Madison argues that political liberty is best protected by

choices.label: a small republic with a parliamentary system
a small democracy with a unitary government
well-regulated militias controlled by state governments
the fragmentation of political power in a large republic

content.answer: the fragmentation of political power in a large republic

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Describe the argument, perspective, evidence, and reasoning presented in the source.
